Today marks one month since dad choked to death, unwitnessed, at the nurses’ desk at Providence Manor - a lonely death.   We celebrate his life but remember his death in calling for increased staffing, better pay, and more oversight in LTC in Ontario.   Our elders deserve it.

I had a chance to visit @ShalomVillage for @Clorox Canada’s #SupportWithStrength launch. As part of the program they will be donating their Total 360 Electrostatic Spray Disinfection Systems and 100 iPads to LTC homes around Ontario to help seniors feel connected and safe.  https://t.co/66gIC5Q6Aq

@kristatee Father currently in chemo. Alone. Friend had ultrasound experience. Alone. 91 yr MIL hospitalized 2 weeks alone (after months alone in LTC). Was allowed visitors only after death was imminent in 24 hours. But sure let's get haircuts and meet for drinks. Business rules all.
